subdisciplines.name: Macroeconomic Policy
subdisciplines.description: The study of the principles and tools needed to plan andmanage economic stability and growth at the national level.

subdisciplines.name: Microeconomic Policy
subdisciplines.description: The study of the principles and tools needed to plan and manage economic growth and development at the local or community level.

subdisciplines.name: Behavioral Economics
subdisciplines.description: The study of the effects of psychological, social, cognitive, and emotional factors on the economic decisions of individuals and institutions.
